meanings.sent1: The priest will sanctify the church before the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: People often sanctify their homes by placing religious symbols.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally sanctified my sandwich by adding too much hot sauce.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words seemed to sanctify the atmosphere around her.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ritual was meant to sanctify the sacred grounds.

meanings.sent1: The water from the spring is believed to sanctify and heal.
meanings.sent2: She used a special herb to sanctify the cooking utensils.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to sanctify itself by licking its fur vigorously.
meanings.sent4: The rain seemed to sanctify the polluted city streets.
meanings.sent5: The cleansing ritual was meant to sanctify the body and mind.

meanings.definition: To set apart for a sacred purpose
meanings.sent1: The ancient tribe would sanctify warriors for battle.
meanings.sent2: The king would sanctify a portion of the harvest for the gods.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to sanctify their treehouse as a secret club.
meanings.sent4: The artist sanctified the brush for a masterpiece painting.
meanings.sent5: The ceremony was held to sanctify the chosen leader.
